body_html:
I believe this behavior is already implemented if you append "/" to the argument of name_scope: https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/Graph#name_scope

Unfortunately this isn't documented in tf.name_scope: https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/name_scope
PRs welcome for this :)

Can you check if adding "/" works for your use case?
body_text:
I believe this behavior is already implemented if you append "/" to the argument of name_scope: https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/Graph#name_scope
Unfortunately this isn't documented in tf.name_scope: https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/name_scope
PRs welcome for this :)
Can you check if adding "/" works for your use case?
body:
I believe this behavior is already implemented if you append "/" to the argument of `name_scope`: https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/Graph#name_scope

Unfortunately this isn't documented in `tf.name_scope`: https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/name_scope
PRs welcome for this :)

Can you check if adding "/" works for your use case?
